meanings.definition: Having the quality of propelling or driving forward.
meanings.sent1: The rocket had a propulsive force that pushed it into space.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind was propulsive, making the sailboat move swiftly across the water.
meanings.sent3: The propulsive energy of the car made it zoom down the highway like a speeding bullet.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was propulsive, propelling the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The propulsive music had everyone on their feet, dancing with energy.

meanings.definition: Causing or tending to cause motion.
meanings.sent1: The propulsive waves crashed against the shore, eroding the sand.
meanings.sent2: The propulsive force of the engine propelled the car forward.
meanings.sent3: The propulsive nature of the roller coaster ride left everyone exhilarated.
meanings.sent4: His propulsive speech inspired the audience to take action.
meanings.sent5: The propulsive energy of the waterfall cascaded down with great force.
